intro: Milleria angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milleria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Milleria angustifolia is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
